FuncDef:
The signal-coding dqpsk command configures the differential quadrature phase shift keying (DQPSK) mode of an interface.
The undo signal-coding dqpsk command restores the default value of the DQPSK mode.
By default, the value of the DQPSK mode that has been sent and received are 1.

ParaDef.Info:
Switches the signal modulation mode of an interface to DQPSK.
-

Specifies the received value of the DQPSK mode that has been received.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8, and the default value is 1.

Specifies the value of the DQPSK mode that has been sent.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8, and the default value is 1.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The coding type of 100GE optical interfaces is DQPSK. The DQPSK encoding/decoding modes of two 100GE optical interfaces must be match so that the two interfaces can interconnect with each other. If 100GE optical interfaces fail to interconnect with each other for the first time, adjust the DQPSK modes of the interfaces. This command is supported on a device only when the device has 100 Gbit/s DWDM optical modules installed.
